com.cyc.kb

Interface KBFactory<T extends KBObject>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The class of Objects that this factory will create

    public interface KBFactory<T extends KBObject>
    The root interface for all KB API object factories.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T findOrCreate(String nameOrId)
      Finds or creates a semantic object, represented by name or HL ID, in the underlying KB.
      T findOrCreate(String nameOrId, KBCollection constrainingCollection)
      Finds or creates a semantic object, represented by name or HL ID, in the underlying KB, as an instance of constrainingCollection.
      T findOrCreate(String nameOrId, KBCollection constrainingCollection, Context ctx)
      Finds or creates a semantic object, represented by name or HL ID, in the underlying KB, as an instance of constrainingCollection in ctx.
      T findOrCreate(String nameOrId, String constrainingCollection)
      Finds or creates a semantic object, represented by name or HL ID, in the underlying KB, as an instance of constrainingCollection.
      T findOrCreate(String nameOrId, String constrainingCollection, String ctx)
      Finds or creates a semantic object, represented by name or HL ID, in the underlying KB, as an instance of constrainingCollection in ctx.
      T get(String nameOrId)
      Finds an entity in the KB, by either name or HL ID, and returns it wrapped in a semantic object.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        T get(String nameOrId)
                       throws KBTypeException,
                              KBApiException
        Finds an entity in the KB, by either name or HL ID, and returns it wrapped in a semantic object. Unlike findOrCreate(String), this method will never modify the contents of the KB.

        When searching, preference is given to HL ID. In the unlikely event that there are two relevant entities in the KB, one with a matching HL ID and the other with a matching name, the entity with the matching HL ID will be returned.

        Parameters:
        nameOrId - either the name or HL ID of an entity in the KB
        Returns:
        semantic object, or null if KB entity does not exist
        Throws:
        KBTypeException - if entity exists in KB but does not currently meet the requirements of the particular semantic object type
        KBApiException - if the semantic object could not be created

      • findOrCreate

        T findOrCreate(String nameOrId)
                                throws KBTypeConflictException,
                                       InvalidNameException,
                                       KBApiException
        Finds or creates a semantic object, represented by name or HL ID, in the underlying KB. If an entity exists in the KB that does not satisfy the requirements of the semantic object, but which could be modified to do so solely by adding new assertions, this method will attempt to add the appropriate assertions to the KB. For example: if a binary predicate is expected, a simple predicate (with no known arity) could be easily modified to be a binary predicate. It could not, however, be turned into a function merely be adding new assertions. Trying to create it as a Function would result in an KBTypeConflictException. If you do not wish to risk modifying the KB, use get(String) instead.

        When searching, preference is given to HL IDs. In the unlikely event that there are two relevant entities in the KB, one with a matching HL ID and the other with a matching name, the entity with the matching HL ID will be returned.

        Note that this method will never create an object if the nameOrId string is a valid HL ID; instead, an InvalidNameException will be thrown. This is to prevent potentially confusing cases where a non-existent entity would be searched for by its HL ID and, in its absence, a new entity would be created which would be named after the expected ID.

        Parameters:
        nameOrId - either the name or HL ID of an entity in the KB
        Returns:
        semantic object
        Throws:
        KBTypeConflictException - if entity exists in KB, but is not of compatible type
        InvalidNameException - if the entity does not exist in the KB, and cannot be created under this name. This factory will reject names if they are valid HL IDs.
        KBApiException - if the entity does not exist in the KB and a semantic object could not be created

      • findOrCreate

        T findOrCreate(String nameOrId,
             KBCollection constrainingCollection)
                                throws KBTypeConflictException,
                                       InvalidNameException,
                                       KBApiException
        Finds or creates a semantic object, represented by name or HL ID, in the underlying KB, as an instance of constrainingCollection. If an entity exists in the KB that does not satisfy the requirements of the semantic object and the constrainingCollection, but which could be made to do so solely by adding new assertions, this method will attempt to add the appropriate assertions to the KB. For example: if a binary predicate is expected, a simple predicate (with no known arity) could be easily modified to be a binary predicate. It could not, however, be turned into a function merely be adding new assertions. Trying to create it as a Function would result in an KBTypeConflictException. If you do not wish to risk modifying the KB, use get(String) instead.

        When searching, preference is given to HL IDs. In the unlikely event that there are two relevant entities in the KB, one with a matching HL ID and the other with a matching name, the entity with the matching HL ID will be returned.

        Note that this method will never create an object if the nameOrId string is a valid HL ID; instead, an InvalidNameException will be thrown. This is to prevent potentially confusing cases where a non-existent entity would be searched for by its HL ID and, in its absence, a new entity would be created which would be named after the expected ID.

        Parameters:
        nameOrId -
        constrainingCollection - the constraining collection of which the entity is an instance
        Returns:
        semantic object
        Throws:
        KBTypeConflictException - if entity exists in KB, but is not of compatible type
        InvalidNameException - if the entity does not exist in the KB, and cannot be created under this name. This factory will reject names if they are valid HL IDs.
        KBApiException - if the entity does not exist in the KB and could not be created

      • findOrCreate

        T findOrCreate(String nameOrId,
             String constrainingCollection)
                                throws KBTypeConflictException,
                                       InvalidNameException,
                                       KBApiException
        Finds or creates a semantic object, represented by name or HL ID, in the underlying KB, as an instance of constrainingCollection. If an entity exists in the KB that does not satisfy the requirements of the semantic object and the constrainingCollection, but which could be made to do so solely by adding new assertions, this method will attempt to add the appropriate assertions to the KB. For example: if a binary predicate is expected, a simple predicate (with no known arity) could be easily modified to be a binary predicate. It could not, however, be turned into a function merely be adding new assertions. Trying to create it as a Function would result in an KBTypeConflictException. If you do not wish to risk modifying the KB, use get(String) instead.

        When searching, preference is given to HL IDs. In the unlikely event that there are two relevant entities in the KB, one with a matching HL ID and the other with a matching name, the entity with the matching HL ID will be returned.

        Note that this method will never create an object if the nameOrId string is a valid HL ID; instead, an InvalidNameException will be thrown. This is to prevent potentially confusing cases where a non-existent entity would be searched for by its HL ID and, in its absence, a new entity would be created which would be named after the expected ID.

        Parameters:
        nameOrId - either the name or HL ID of an entity in the KB
        constrainingCollection - the constraining collection of which the entity is an instance
        Returns:
        semantic object
        Throws:
        KBTypeConflictException - if entity exists in KB, but is not of compatible type
        InvalidNameException - if the entity does not exist in the KB, and cannot be created under this name. This factory will reject names if they are valid HL IDs.
        KBApiException - if the entity does not exist in the KB and could not be created

      • findOrCreate

        T findOrCreate(String nameOrId,
             KBCollection constrainingCollection,
             Context ctx)
                                throws KBTypeConflictException,
                                       InvalidNameException,
                                       KBApiException
        Finds or creates a semantic object, represented by name or HL ID, in the underlying KB, as an instance of constrainingCollection in ctx. If an entity exists in the KB that does not satisfy the requirements of the semantic object and the constrainingCollection, but which could be made to do so solely by adding new assertions, this method will attempt to add the appropriate assertions to the KB. For example: if a binary predicate is expected, a simple predicate (with no known arity) could be easily modified to be a binary predicate. It could not, however, be turned into a function merely be adding new assertions. Trying to create it as a Function would result in an KBTypeConflictException. If you do not wish to risk modifying the KB, use get(String) instead.

        When searching, preference is given to HL IDs. In the unlikely event that there are two relevant entities in the KB, one with a matching HL ID and the other with a matching name, the entity with the matching HL ID will be returned.

        Note that this method will never create an object if the nameOrId string is a valid HL ID; instead, an InvalidNameException will be thrown. This is to prevent potentially confusing cases where a non-existent entity would be searched for by its HL ID and, in its absence, a new entity would be created which would be named after the expected ID.

        Parameters:
        nameOrId - either the name or HL ID of an entity in the KB
        constrainingCollection - the constraining collection of which the entity is an instance
        ctx - the microtheory under which the search for the entity is performed
        Returns:
        semantic object
        Throws:
        KBTypeConflictException - if entity exists in KB, but is not of compatible type
        InvalidNameException - if the entity does not exist in the KB, and cannot be created under this name. This factory will reject names if they are valid HL IDs.
        KBApiException - if the entity does not exist in the KB and a semantic object could not be created

      • findOrCreate

        T findOrCreate(String nameOrId,
             String constrainingCollection,
             String ctx)
                                throws KBTypeConflictException,
                                       InvalidNameException,
                                       KBApiException
        Finds or creates a semantic object, represented by name or HL ID, in the underlying KB, as an instance of constrainingCollection in ctx. If an entity exists in the KB that does not satisfy the requirements of the semantic object and the constrainingCollection, but which could be made to do so solely by adding new assertions, this method will attempt to add the appropriate assertions to the KB. For example: if a binary predicate is expected, a simple predicate (with no known arity) could be easily modified to be a binary predicate. It could not, however, be turned into a function merely be adding new assertions. Trying to create it as a Function would result in an KBTypeConflictException. If you do not wish to risk modifying the KB, use get(String) instead.

        When searching, preference is given to HL IDs. In the unlikely event that there are two relevant entities in the KB, one with a matching HL ID and the other with a matching name, the entity with the matching HL ID will be returned.

        Note that this method will never create an object if the nameOrId string is a valid HL ID; instead, an InvalidNameException will be thrown. This is to prevent potentially confusing cases where a non-existent entity would be searched for by its HL ID and, in its absence, a new entity would be created which would be named after the expected ID.

        Parameters:
        nameOrId - either the name or HL ID of an entity in the KB
        constrainingCollection - the constraining collection of which the entity is an instance
        ctx - the microtheory under which the search for the entity is performed
        Returns:
        semantic object
        Throws:
        KBTypeConflictException - if entity exists in KB, but is not of compatible type
        InvalidNameException - if the entity does not exist in the KB, and cannot be created under this name. This factory will reject names if they are valid HL IDs.
        KBApiException - if the entity does not exist in the KB and a semantic object could not be created
